item.title: 澳大利亚社交媒体青少年禁令软件试用组织者称技术可行
item.description: 世界上最大的年龄检查技术试验负责人周五表示，一些年龄检查应用程序收集了太多的数据，而且没有任何产品在100%的时间内都有效，但在澳大利亚，使用软件来执行青少年社交媒体禁令是可行的。【原文：Some age-checking applications collect too much data and no product works 100% of the time, but using software to enforce a teenage social media ban can work in Australia, the head of the world's biggest trial of the technology said on Friday.】

item.title: 日本贸易谈判代表称美国关税谈判 "雾里看花
item.description: 日本最高贸易谈判代表赤泽亮世周五表示，尽管双方都在努力寻求达成协议，但与美国的贸易谈判 "仍处于迷雾之中"。【原文：Japan's top trade negotiator Ryosei Akazawa said on Friday that trade negotiations with the U.S. "remained in a fog" despite efforts by both sides to seek an agreement.】

item.title: 受出口限制影响，5 月份中国稀土磁体发货量减半
item.description: 由于出口限制，5 月份中国稀土磁铁的海外发货量比 4 月份减少了一半，跌至五年多来的最低水平。【原文：China's overseas shipments of rare earth magnets halved in May from April, tumbling to their lowest levels in more than five years due to export curbs.】

item.title: 独家报道：全球贸易巨头加强在印度的业务，推动人才抢夺和交易所升级
item.description: 从 Citadel Securities 和 IMC Trading，到 Millennium 和 Optiver，半打全球交易巨头都在印度蓬勃发展的衍生品市场加大投入，推动了印度的招聘热潮，并推动交易所改进技术。【原文：Half a dozen global trading giants, from Citadel Securities and IMC Trading to Millennium and Optiver, are ratcheting up their presence in India's booming derivatives markets, fuelling a hiring spree and pushing exchanges to improve technology.】

item.title: 越南商务部：越南与美国就新贸易协定举行谈判
item.description: 越南工贸部周五表示，越南和美国于周四晚就新贸易协定举行了一轮在线谈判。【原文：Vietnam and the United States held an online round of negotiations on a new trade deal on Thursday night, the Ministry of Industry and Trade said on Friday.】

item.title: 特朗普权衡美国对伊朗的行动，股市陷入困境，原油连续第三周上涨
item.description: 周五，由于担心美国可能攻击伊朗，亚洲股市在寻找方向的过程中举步维艰，而油价则因以色列与伊朗冲突升级而准备连续第三周上涨。【原文：Share markets in Asia struggled for direction on Friday as fears of a potential U.S. attack on Iran hung over markets, while oil prices were poised to rise for a third straight week on the escalating Israel-Iran conflict.】

item.title: 受避险吸引力提振，美元本周将以乐观态势收官
item.description: 周五，美元将创下一个多月以来的最大单周涨幅，因为中东战火纷飞的不确定性及其可能对全球经济造成的影响，激发了人们对传统避险天堂的追捧。【原文：The dollar was set to log its biggest weekly rise in over a month on Friday, as uncertainties about a raging war in the Middle East and the repercussions it could have on the global economy fuelled an appetite for traditional safe havens.】

item.title: 世界银行敦促发展中国家 "彻底 "提高债务透明度
item.description: 世界银行在周五发布的一份报告中说，世界银行敦促发展中国家及其贷款人 "彻底 "提高债务透明度，以避免未来的危机。【原文：The World Bank is urging "radical" debt transparency for developing countries and their lenders to stave off future crises, it said in a report released on Friday.】

item.title: 以色列与伊朗冲突升级，石油将连续第三周上涨
item.description: 尽管周五油价下滑，但油价仍有望连续第三周上涨，因为以色列和伊朗之间持续一周的战争没有显示出任何一方退让的迹象，这令投资者惶恐不安。【原文：Oil prices were on track to rise for the third straight week despite slipping on Friday, with investors on edge as the week-old war between Israel and Iran showed no signs of either side backing down.】

item.title: 花旗银行认为，如果战争中断伊朗 110 万桶/日的石油出口，油价将达到 75-78 美元/桶
item.description: 花旗银行（Citibank）的分析师周四表示，如果战争导致伊朗每天110万桶的石油出口中断，那么两伊敌对行动的升级可能会使布伦特油价比冲突前的水平高出约15%至20%。【原文：An escalation of the Iran-Israeli hostilities could keep Brent oil prices trading about 15% to 20% above pre-conflict levels if the war disrupts 1.1 million barrels per day (bpd) of Iranian oil exports, analysts at Citibank said on Thursday.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：欧盟调查马斯克 xAI 收购 X 公司一事
item.description: 据彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周四报道，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）斥资 330 亿美元收购 XAI 公司的交易引起了欧盟的新一轮审查，因为监管机构正在评估根据《数字服务法案》（Digital Services Act）可能处以的罚款。【原文：Elon Musk's $33 billion xAI acquisition of X has drawn fresh scrutiny from the European Union, as regulators evaluate potential fines under the Digital Services Act, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 卡尼表示，加拿大将解决钢铁和铝行业的不公平贸易问题
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）周四告诉记者，加拿大将很快采取关税措施，以应对全球钢铁和铝行业持续产能过剩和不公平贸易带来的风险。【原文：Canada will soon adopt tariff measures to address risks associated with persistent global overcapacity and unfair trade in the steel and aluminum sectors, Prime Minister Mark Carney told reporters on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普称已签署行政命令，延长关闭 TikTok 的最后期限
item.description: 美国总统特朗普周四表示，他将中国字节跳动公司（ByteDance）剥离 TikTok 美国资产的 6 月 19 日最后期限延长了 90 天。【原文：President Trump said on Thursday that he extended the June 19 deadline for China-based ByteDance to divest the U.S. assets of TikTok for 90 days.】

item.title: 石油、战争和关税撕裂了市场的央行路线图
item.description: 挪威周四令人震惊的降息突显了美国关税、中东冲突和美元动荡如何使全球货币政策和通胀更加难以预测，投资者对日益不确定的环境的不安情绪正在上升。【原文：Investor unease about an increasingly uncertain environment is rising, as Norway's shock rate cut on Thursday highlights how U.S. tariffs, Middle East conflict and a shaky dollar make global monetary policy and inflation even harder to predict.】

item.title: 无人机制造商利用 "僚机 "争夺制空权
item.description: 国防重量级企业和新兴军事技术公司在巴黎航展上展示了被称为 "僚机 "的尖端无人机--这种无人驾驶飞机旨在与下一代战斗机并肩飞行，重塑未来空战。【原文：Defence heavyweights and emerging military tech firms used the Paris Airshow to showcase cutting-edge drones known as "wingmen" - uncrewed aircraft designed to fly alongside next-generation fighter jets and reshape the future of air combat.】

item.title: 格陵兰向欧盟支持的关键金属项目颁发采矿许可证
item.description: 格陵兰周四向欧盟支持的一个项目颁发了为期30年的许可证，该项目旨在开采钼矿，钼是航空航天、能源和国防领域使用的一种重要金属，中国对其实施了出口管制。【原文：Greenland on Thursday handed a 30-year permit to a European Union-backed project that aims to mine molybdenum, a critical metal used in aerospace, energy and defence and on which China has imposed export controls.】

item.title: 追踪者称，伊朗为在冲突期间维持石油出口进行了调整
item.description: 两家船舶跟踪公司告诉路透社，伊朗正在通过一艘一艘地装载油轮和将浮动石油储存库移到更靠近中国的地方来维持原油供应，因为伊朗正寻求在受到以色列攻击的同时保持一个关键的收入来源。【原文：Iran is maintaining crude oil supply by loading tankers one at a time and moving floating oil storage much closer to China, two vessel tracking firms told Reuters, as the country seeks to keep a key source of revenue while under attack from Israel.】

item.title: 印度 TCS 称其系统未在 M&S 黑客攻击中受损
item.description: 塔塔咨询服务公司（Tata Consultancy Services）表示，该公司的 "系统或用户均未受到影响"，这次网络攻击导致该公司十多年的客户--零售商玛莎百货（Marks and Spencer）的客户数据被盗。【原文：Tata Consultancy Services said none of its "systems or users were compromised" as part of the cyberattack that led to the theft of customer data at retailer Marks and Spencer , its client of more than a decade.】

item.title: 稀土获取是欧盟在中国峰会上的优先事项
item.description: 四位熟悉该计划的消息人士称，欧盟领导人将利用下月与中国举行的峰会寻求更好地获得中国稀土和关键矿产的机会，同时双方将处理一系列与关税相关的问题。【原文：European Union leaders will use a summit with China next month to seek better access to Chinese rare earths and critical minerals, four sources familiar with the plans said, as the two sides tackle an array of tariff-related issues.】

item.title: 战争和关税迷雾重重，部分央行下调利率
item.description: 周四，瑞士和挪威央行成为最新一批放松货币政策的欧洲利率制定者，理由是通胀前景疲软，与美联储对美国物价上涨的警告形成鲜明对比。【原文：The Swiss and Norwegian central banks became the latest European rate-setters to ease monetary policy on Thursday, citing a weaker inflation outlook that contrasted sharply with the Federal Reserve's warnings about higher U.S. prices.】

item.title: 全球不确定性让大型央行陷入困境
item.description: 各国央行正在努力应对经济增长和通货膨胀的不确定性上升，这使得决策变得更加复杂，尤其是对于那些在降息周期接近尾声时试图调整政策的央行而言。【原文：Central banks are grappling with elevated uncertainty about economic growth and inflation, complicating decision-making, especially for those trying to calibrate policy as they near the end of their rate-cutting cycles.】

item.title: 亚马逊将在印度投资 2.33 亿美元，用于扩建运营基础设施和改进技术
item.description: 亚马逊周四表示，2025 年将在印度投资 200 多亿卢比（约合 2.33 亿美元），以扩大和更新其运营基础设施，为其配送网络开发新技术，并提高配送安全性。【原文：Amazon will invest more than 20 billion rupees ($233 million) in India in 2025 to expand and update its operations infrastructure, develop new technology for its fulfilment network and improve delivery safety, it said on Thursday.】

item.title: 琥珀色的谷物浪潮 "在美国中心地带消退，麦农陷入困境
item.description: 五月一个大雾弥漫的早晨，丹尼斯-舍恩哈尔斯（Dennis Schoenhals）驱车带着一车农作物侦察员在俄克拉荷马州北部的麦田里巡视，这是每年一度的农作物健康状况评估之旅的一部分。但在一些麦田里，舍恩哈尔斯和其他农民已经放弃了收割谷物出售的计划，因为价格已经跌至五年来的最低点。【原文：On a foggy morning in May, Dennis Schoenhals drove a carload of crop scouts around the wheat fields of northern Oklahoma, part of an annual tour to evaluate the health of the crop. But on some fields, Schoenhals and other farmers had already abandoned plans to harvest the grain for sale because prices had sunk to five-year lows.】

item.title: 欧洲消息人士称，欧盟越来越不愿意在美国贸易谈判中接受 10%的基准关税
item.description: 五位熟悉谈判情况的消息人士称，欧洲官员越来越倾向于将 10%的 "对等 "关税作为美国与欧盟之间任何贸易协议的基准。【原文：European officials are increasingly resigned to a 10% rate on "reciprocal" tariffs being the baseline in any trade deal between the United States and the European Union, five sources familiar with the negotiations said.】

item.title: 英国央行维持利率稳定，认为就业市场疲软将进一步放宽政策
item.description: 英国央行将利率维持在 4.25%，但表示重点关注劳动力市场疲软和中东冲突升级导致能源价格上涨带来的风险。【原文：The Bank of England held interest rates at 4.25% but said it was focused on risks from a weaker labour market and higher energy prices as conflict in the Middle East escalates.】

item.title: Stellantis 要求下架数千辆安全气囊有问题的雪铁龙汽车
item.description: Stellantis 公司发言人周四表示，该公司已要求将法国 82,000 辆装有高田故障气囊的雪铁龙 C3 和 DS3 汽车从公路上移除，一周前，兰斯一名妇女因 2014 年雪铁龙 C3 上的一个安全气囊受伤而死亡。【原文：Stellantis has asked for 82,000 Citroen C3 and DS3 vehicles in France with faulty Takata airbags to be removed from roads, a company spokesperson said on Thursday, one week after a woman in Reims died from injuries sustained by one of the airbags in a 2014 Citroen C3.】

item.title: 联合国贸易机构警告：关税可能导致全球投资下滑加剧
item.description: 联合国贸易和发展会议在周四发布的一份报告中说，2024 年全球外国直接投资连续第二年下降，由于贸易紧张局势动摇了投资者的信心，今年的情况可能更糟。【原文：Global foreign direct investment fell for the second consecutive year in 2024, with fears this year could be even worse as trade tensions rock investor confidence, the United Nations agency for trade and development said in a report published on Thursday.】

item.title: 本田支持的 Helm.ai 推出自动驾驶汽车视觉系统
item.description: 本田表示，它正在与其他汽车制造商洽谈在大众市场汽车中部署自动驾驶技术的事宜。【原文：Honda said it was in talks with other automakers to deploy its self-driving technology in mass-market vehicles.】

item.title: 中国廉价电动汽车充斥巴西引发反弹
item.description: 世界上最大的汽车运输船（相当于 20 个足球场的汽车容量）于上月底完成首航，停靠在巴西伊塔雅伊港。【原文：The world's largest car-carrying ship - with the equivalent of 20 football fields of vehicles - completed its maiden journey late last month to dock in Brazil's Itajai port.】

item.title: 2025 年全球首次公开募股活动因关税和波动性影响而下滑
item.description: 今年以来，受美国关税带来的商业不确定性加剧、市场波动加剧以及利率上升等因素的影响，全球股市首次公开募股（IPO）大幅下滑，这些因素导致融资成本上升，降低了上市对发行人的吸引力。【原文：Global equity IPOs have plunged this year, weighed down by heightened business uncertainty from U.S. tariffs, elevated market volatility and higher interest rates that have raised funding costs and made listings less appealing for issuers.】
